INTRO: ^The stone beneath you is cold, not unlike ice. It consumes what little light is in the room. Painful chains surround you and bite into your limbs, like ravenous snakes.
^Your thoughts move like insects in glue; 23<~>they feel trapped, with no end in sight.</~> Trapped. Just like you.
^Another voice drifts from your left. 26<~>"Does it know its name?"</~>
^A pair of blue eyes glint faintly, locked on you without blinking.
^A scoff from your right — low, sharp, and dripping with disdain. Red eyes burn faintly in the dark.
^The center figure’s tone cuts the air clean in half. The others fall silent instantly.
^The one in the middle fixes you with a stare so steady you shiver, 16<~>though not from the cold. </~>

c-1: ^Your throat stings as it comes back to life.
^The red-eyed one lets out a sharp, wicked laugh. "Told you it wouldn't remember, Truth."
^A glance from the center stops him cold.
^The one on the left - Truth - tilts their head, studying you as though you were a specimen. "Or perhaps it chooses not to. A fascinating find, Judgement."
^Your head throbs again — sharper this time, a spike of pain from the left.
^Only Truth seems to notice — or care.
^"Either way," Judgement, the centre figure, says, voice even but unyielding, "that’s why it was chosen."
^They murmur to each other — fragments of names escape into your ears:
^a firm "Mercy" to the one with red eyes,
^and to the center one, with great respect... 'Judgement'.
^Somewhere far away, a church bell tolls, muffled but echoing in your skull.
^Truth exhales sharply. "Ah. It is almost time. Before you leave us, would you like to ask a question? We will not lie — but there are things you may wish you’d never know."
^Your mind races. 25<~>What should you ask them?

CHOOSE_NAME_SILENT_ONE: ^You say nothing, holding the center figure’s gaze.
^Images surge unbidden — flickers of a past life, blurred and fading before you can grasp them.
^You break the stare at last, but the white glow of those eyes has burned itself into your vision. 26<~>Forever watching. Forever judging.</~>
^The red-eyed one steps forward, eyes flaring brighter. 17<~>"We don't have all night, mortal. Speak."</~>
CHOOSE_NAME_SILENT_TWO: ^You keep your mouth shut, jaw set tight.
^The one with red eyes chuckles. "Well, Judgement. It lost its voice as well."
^"Mercy. Silence." Judgement's voice stops him cold. "Truth, do you believe it knows its name?"
^The blue-eyed figure blinks twice. "Perhaps it does. Perhaps it doesn't."
^Even in your silence, their names linger in thought: Mercy, Truth, Judgement.
INPUT_NAME: ^..."</~> Your dry throat barely croaks out the word.
^?"</~> the center figure repeats, deep in thought.
^The one with red eyes smirks, cruel and amused. 23<~>"Judgement, it has a ghost’s name! How quaint."</~>
^"Indeed, Mercy." Judgement, the silhouette in the middle, narrows their blindingly white eyes.
^The figure on the right must be Mercy, you think.
^The last unnamed one tilts their head. 24<~>"I believe it thinks</~> it remembers.
^But lies are impossible, child," they whisper.
^Pain blooms again behind your eyes — stronger this time.
^"You are right, Truth," 21<~>Judgement says.</~> "Falsehood only stains what little image one has left."
^Even as they speak, you know that their names - Mercy, Truth, Judgement - are now forever etched into your memory.
QUESTION_INTRO: ^A church bell rings in the distance, muffled.
^Truth exhales, almost wistful. "Ah. It is almost time. Before you leave us, would you like to ask a question? We will not lie — but there are things you may wish you’d never known."
^Your mind races. What should you ask them?

QUESTION_SILENT_TWO: ^"You're too slow." There's an audible sigh from Truth. "There's no time left."

b: ^You gulp, having decided what to ask.
^"What... are you going to do to me?"
^You gulp, having finally decided what to ask.
^"What... are you going to do to me?"

c-0: ^"A terrible question," Truth says, disappointed. "You'll find out anyway."
c-1: ^You're unsure of whether you should ask this. You decide to stay safe and rethink your decisions.
^Mercy grows impatient. "Well then, what is it? We're running out of time."

b: ^You gulp, having decided what to ask.
^You gulp, having finally decided what to ask.

c-0: ^Judgement answers. "You may call us the Witnesses."
^"For we are witnesses to all: death, birth and everything in-between," Mercy finishes.

^Mercy, impatient: "Well then, what is it? We're running out of time."

^You gulp, having finally decided what to ask.

c-0: ^"The Mask chose our meeting place." Judgement says. "It was not our decision."
c-1: ^You're unsure of whether you should ask this. The only thing you're sure of is that they know you're unsure.
^Mercy grows impatient. "Well then, what is it? We're running out of time."

b: ^You gulp, having decided what to ask.
^You gulp, having finally decided what to ask.

c-0: ^"You are here because you were chosen," says Mercy.
^"It was not our decision. If it was, you wouldn't be with us."
^He spits on the ground in front of you.
^"Do not question that of the Mask!" Judgement snaps.
c-1: ^You're unsure of whether you should ask this. You decide to stay safe and rethink your decisions.

FINAL: ^"Finally. It's time," says Judgement. "Let us end this... meeting."
^After a bit, Judgement steps forward, drawing something from the folds of their robe.
^They hold a mask, darker than the void itself, dotted with depictions of white eyes.
^It's forced on your face before you can recoil.
OSSANETH_MASK: ^You cannot resist. It binds to you, like an old scar reopening.
^Cold floods your vision. The floor tilts.
^You try to cry, to shout, to scream... but your tongue has forgotten the shape of sound.
^A voice curls behind your thoughts — smooth, flat, and unbearably near.
^<sfx="sfx-shake">"I see what is, what was, and what shall be. And now you shall too."</sfx="sfx-shake">
